title: Dominican Republic presidential candidate attempts to have his mother recast her primary vote
text:
The moment a presidential candidate tried to recast his mom's vote after she accidentally chose 'none of the above' on her primary ballot in the Dominican Republic has been caught on video.

Miriam Terrero de Castillo was accompanied to the polling center by her son, Gonzalo Castillo, a candidate on the ruling Dominican Liberation Party (PLD) ticket.

After submitting his ballot at a nearby table, the candidate walked over to his mother and repeatedly said, 'She wishes to vote. She wishes to vote. She wishes to vote.'

Gonzalo Castillo (center), a candidate on the ruling Dominican Liberation Party (PLD) ticket for the 2020 presidential election, fought to have his mother recast her vote (left)

Gonzalo Castillo deposits his primary vote before he won the Dominican Liberation Party's nomination on Sunday in the Dominican Republic

Former president Leonel Fernández, who ruled in the Dominican Republic from 1996 to 2000 and from 2004 to 2012, failed in his attempt to win his party's nomination

However, a polling station worker informed Castillo that his mother had already submitted her vote by selecting 'none' instead of her son, who was one of five candidates listed along with former president Leonel Fernández, who ruled the Dominican Republic from 1996 to 2000 and from 2004 to 2012.

After a reporter asked what was going on, a poll site volunteer revealed Castillo's mother had not voted for her son.

'Hey, hey, hold on, get out of here,' an agitated Castillo shouted at the polling station worker.

In the end, Castillo won without his mother's vote, triumphing over the ex-president of the Caribbean island by 911,923 votes to 885,233 to represent the PLD in the 2020 elections.

However, Fernández complained on Monday, alleging voting fraud and demanding a recount of the 39,539 votes listed on the 'none' ballot, which registered the third-highest amount of votes.
description: Gonzalo Castillo was caught on video attempting to resubmit his mom's presidential primary ballot in the Dominican Republic on Sunday.
